snippet.textDisplay: I'll agree with that. As little extreme that Delta assumed that all would resonate across all the timelines and end up at the final one. And the stuff with Sigma and Phi got a little out there. But still love the series so much.
snippet.textOriginal: I'll agree with that. As little extreme that Delta assumed that all would resonate across all the timelines and end up at the final one. And the stuff with Sigma and Phi got a little out there. But still love the series so much.

I liked ZTD, but when they start shifting everywhere the story got too ridiculous.

snippet.textDisplay: Nuts at the end when Delta says that there will be no Radical-6 outbreak in the final timeline, meaning that mankind will go extinct, but that the participants now are determined to change the future if they shoot him.

snippet.textDisplay:
"Hey, are you any good at Sudoku?"
"Yeah, why?"
"I just need your help on this puzzle."
"Er, sure... Are you ok? You look like you've been crying."
"JUST SHUT UP AND HELP ME!"
snippet.textOriginal:
"Hey, are you any good at Sudoku?"
"Yeah, why?"
"I just need your help on this puzzle."
"Er, sure... Are you ok? You look like you've been crying."
"JUST SHUT UP AND HELP ME!"

snippet.textDisplay: I absolutely love this. It's simple, but sad and creepy at the same time. And I swear part of it makes me feel like things will get better...like even though you're in a dark place now, it won't always be that way. It's hard to describe... I've never heard of this game before listening to this track, but this alone makes me want to seek it out and play it.
snippet.textOriginal: I absolutely love this. It's simple, but sad and creepy at the same time. And I swear part of it makes me feel like things will get better...like even though you're in a dark place now, it won't always be that way. It's hard to describe... I've never heard of this game before listening to this track, but this alone makes me want to seek it out and play it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yes! One of my favorite DS games and my favorite track too. This really enhances the emotion of the scene it plays in, so good. Now I just have to go track down the sequel.

I've read Ever17 as well, and I can definitely see the similarities in the story- but they're both really good. Since the Infinity series stopped having releases I'm glad the writer found other work, I really enjoy his stories.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yes! One of my favorite DS games and my favorite track too. This really enhances the emotion of the scene it plays in, so good. Now I just have to go track down the sequel.

I've read Ever17 as well, and I can definitely see the similarities in the story- but they're both really good. Since the Infinity series stopped having releases I'm glad the writer found other work, I really enjoy his stories.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh definitely, there are some standouts to be sure. It's still a really good soundtrack, I found it just wasn't quite as impactful as 999's soundtrack. Saying that, the Q room music is phenomenal.

snippet.textDisplay: You need to play Zero Escape. They improved the puzzles by a lot, and the story is just as great. You can also jump to practically any place in the story you want to, so solving puzzles multiple times are not mandatory.

snippet.textDisplay: Yes. There are many twists and turns. The other people have important stories of their own. I suppose it's a shame you know the main villain as it was a surprise when I played through but it doesn't matter. It's not the villain that is important in a way. It is the current situation in which the characters find themselves in.
snippet.textOriginal: Yes. There are many twists and turns. The other people have important stories of their own. I suppose it's a shame you know the main villain as it was a surprise when I played through but it doesn't matter. It's not the villain that is important in a way. It is the current situation in which the characters find themselves in.

snippet.textDisplay: I WANT to know the story so bad and I have no spoilers either...but I have to admit I can't stand puzzle games like this. I need to know, if I just grabbed a guide and skipped half the puzzles would it ruin the story experience in anyway? I have a copy but could barely play it because I can't get into the gameplay. Not that I can't solve the puzzles but it doesn't interest me that much and I've actually fallen asleep before.

snippet.textDisplay:
Also, THIS FREAKIN' SCENE.

Not spoiling anything, but this scene has one of the best, and perhaps most powerful, uses of the two screens in any DS game.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've worked my way through half of the endings, and I wonder if I'm on the right thought train. The game has great character depth! It felt really realistic and gave me dreams at night about the decisions I (could) have made!

It's a experience and well crafted game =D
snippet.textOriginal:
I've worked my way through half of the endings, and I wonder if I'm on the right thought train. The game has great character depth! It felt really realistic and gave me dreams at night about the decisions I (could) have made!

It's a experience and well crafted game =D

snippet.textDisplay:
The skipping text was nice, if it wasn't for the fact that you'd have to hold down the B button for 5 minutes straight to skip the introductory text in the main hall.

Its sequel, Virtue's Last Reward, fixed this issue by having you just jump to branching parts of the story instead of from the beginning.
snippet.textOriginal:
The skipping text was nice, if it wasn't for the fact that you'd have to hold down the B button for 5 minutes straight to skip the introductory text in the main hall.

Its sequel, Virtue's Last Reward, fixed this issue by having you just jump to branching parts of the story instead of from the beginning.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh god the feels
snippet.textOriginal: Oh god the feels

snippet.textDisplay: Many times I'd find﻿ myself thinking "Is﻿ this a hole in the story?" only for the game to fill it later on, as if the writer knew exactly what I was thinking. All the characters are memorable too. The gameplay is alright with some great puzzles, but it's really all about the story. As a big fan of Shinji Hosoe's work on Xenosaga II, I was pleasantly surprised by his work on this game. Nice balance of relaxing and tense, scary themes.
snippet.textOriginal: Many times I'd find﻿ myself thinking "Is﻿ this a hole in the story?" only for the game to fill it later on, as if the writer knew exactly what I was thinking. All the characters are memorable too. The gameplay is alright with some great puzzles, but it's really all about the story. As a big fan of Shinji Hosoe's work on Xenosaga II, I was pleasantly surprised by his work on this game. Nice balance of relaxing and tense, scary themes.

snippet.textDisplay: Got all the endings, what a great absorbing story/intrigue. No spoilers here please. Being able to fast forward through all the text that you've already read during your previous playthroughs made it a lot less tedious, and the True Ending definitely pays off. Such a story should feel convoluted and really hard to follow, but the writing is so superb that it makes sure to give you most of the answers you need.
snippet.textOriginal: Got all the endings, what a great absorbing story/intrigue. No spoilers here please. Being able to fast forward through all the text that you've already read during your previous playthroughs made it a lot less tedious, and the True Ending definitely pays off. Such a story should feel convoluted and really hard to follow, but the writing is so superb that it makes sure to give you most of the answers you need.
